Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately illustrate a healthy, green plant with water, showcasing well-developed leaves and stems.
The student can depict a wilting plant without water, showing drooping leaves and bent stems.
The student can illustrate a plant in the sunlight, appearing robust and thriving.
The student can show a plant in the dark that appears not to be growing well, possibly with yellowish leaves.
The student can include multiple examples to identify patterns, showing a series of plant drawings demonstrating stages of growth with varying light and water conditions.
The student can accurately interpret their own observations, illustrating classroom activities or personal experiences, such as a project tracking plant growth based on different watering schedules.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit minor details such as the sun or a water source in one of their drawings, though this does not affect the overall understanding (e.g., *sometimes forgets to add all elements consistently*).
The student might inconsistently label some elements, like forgetting to label 'water' in one instance, but these instances are rare (e.g., *infrequent omission of labels*).
